meanings.definition: To browse excessively, especially by animals, causing damage to vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The deer were overbrowsing the forest, eating all the plants in sight.
meanings.sent2: The goats were overbrowsing the hillside, leaving little greenery behind.
meanings.sent3: The rabbits were overbrowsing the garden, turning it into their personal buffet.
meanings.sent4: The sheep overbrowsing the meadow resembled a lawnmower on overdrive.
meanings.sent5: Overbrowsing by the cattle turned the once lush field into a barren wasteland.

meanings.definition: The act of consuming too much vegetation, leading to negative ecological impacts.
meanings.sent1: The overbrowsing of the area by the elephants caused a shortage of food for other animals.
meanings.sent2: The overbrowsing of the grasslands resulted in a decline in biodiversity.
meanings.sent3: The overbrowsing of the park by the giraffes was like a never-ending feast.
meanings.sent4: The overbrowsing of the forest painted a grim picture of ecological imbalance.
meanings.sent5: The overbrowsing of the region left a lasting mark on the ecosystem.
